channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

item.title: Report I-2024100017
item.description:
Report I-2024100017

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T15:11:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-05
  • City: DFW Airport
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LUFTHANSA CARGO INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As per the labeling shipment contains RCM UN2795 Batteries, wet, filled with alali Shipment is not booked as DGD RCM. AWB/FWB does not show any DG material and/or special codes as DGD, RFL. HAWB/FHL has been provided as CIVIL AIRCRAFT PARTS DGD attached with the documents and with the freight.

item.title: Report E-2024010395
item.description:
Report E-2024010395

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: ABILENE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: As a result of a forklift puncture, a 5-gallon jerrican containing Kiwo Stencil Remover was punctured and released 1-gallon of product onto the concrete dock floor impacting a 5'x5' area. A Contractor clean-up the release with oil dry. The damaged product, spill debris, and PPE were containerized for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by the incident.

item.title: Report E-2024010385
item.description:
Report E-2024010385

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported 14 oz. release of (UN1950) NON-CHLORINATED BRAKE CLEANER from an aerosol can inside of a carton on their trailer. The release was contained inside of the carton. The spill was due to improper loading from terminal LFW. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt confident cleaning the release and containerizing waste into a 8-gallon DM, which was left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010398
item.description:
Report E-2024010398

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-19
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 19, 2024, at 2053 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal LEP. It was reported that approximately 1-gallon of El Pinol 85 (Pine Oil 60%) UN1272 was released from 55-gallon metal drum due to pinhole puncture. The release impacted the dock and trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable that terminal personnel was capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on-site. The terminal did not have a drum large enough to overpack the damaged drum that was leaking. ERTS dispatched contractors to drop off an 85-gallon metal drum for terminal personnel. Once arrived, terminal personnel placed the damaged drum and all impacted absorbents into the drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024010353
item.description:
Report E-2024010353

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 ounces of DOWSIL™ Z-6689 (UN1993) Water Repellent was released from one 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3173109. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1) 65-gallon DM containing DOWSIL™ Z-6689 Water Repellent was created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010479
item.description:
Report X-2024010479

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: CORPUS CHRISTI
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was out for delivery. Upon arrival of service provider, the leak was spotted and taken to the customer for clean up at location. Service provider returned the empty jerrican to the station to report on the damage of the package. DescribePack: One puncture at the bottom corner of the jerrican. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cleanup at delivery location.

item.title: Report X-2024010165
item.description:
Report X-2024010165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T00:34:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THIS HAZMAT WAS LEFT ON THE FLOOR IN THE CENTER OFF THE QA AREA, NO SPILLAGE AT THIS TIME THE LIQUID HAD ALREADY EXPELLED. AT THIS TIME PPE WAS USED TO PUT THE HAZMAT INSIDE OF THE YELLOW DRUM FOR SAFETY. DescribePack: DIDN'T SEE THE FAILURE HOWEVER IT WAS DROPPED AND ALL THE LIQUID IS EXPELLED FROME GLASS CONTAINER DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED INSIDE THE BLUE BAG AND PUT INTO THE YELLOW DRUM AND PLACE IN THE HAZMAT CAGE

item.title: Report E-2024010345
item.description:
Report E-2024010345

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-20T00:33:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: SAN ANTONIO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of One Ethanol Racing Fuel E85+117 (UN3475) were released from (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted the dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and it was determined that they were okay to clean it with PPE at location. The debris and PPE were placed into a 20-gallon DM and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
